Class ByteUtil

java.lang.Object
  ByteUtil

public class ByteUtil
extends java.lang.Object

A simple class comprised of various tools used in handling of byte arrays. The most used features include multiplexing, demultiplexing, selecting sub-arrays, and concatenating arrays.

concat

public static byte[] concat(byte[] alpha,
                            byte[] beta)
Simple function to concatenate two byte arrays into a single byte array. If alpha = {a,l,p,h,a} and beta = {b,e,t,a} then the resulting array would be {a,l,p,h,a,b,e,t,a}.

Parameters:
alpha - any byte array
beta - any byte array
Returns:
Single array concatenating alpha and beta

subarray

public static byte[] subarray(byte[] array,
                              int fromIndex,
                              int length)
Building on the arraycopy function in System, this function returns a "subarray" of a larger array. The length parameter determines the length of the resulting array. Standard out of bounds exceptions on length can be expected.

Parameters:
array -
fromIndex - first element in returned array
length - amount to read from array
Returns:
byte array consisting of elements in range [fromIndex,fromIndex+length]
See Also:
ByteUtil#subarray(byte[], int)}

fromHexString

public static byte[] fromHexString(java.lang.String hexString)
This method converts String containing hexadecimal duplets into a byte array. Spaces are optional, but values will be read as duplets so spaces do not signify separate bytes. If there are an odd number of hexadecimal characters then the last character will be treated as if it were preceded by a zero.

Example:
00 23 1213 is congruent to 00231213 and will parse to [0,35,18,19]
00 23 121 is congruent to 0023121 and will parse to [0,35,18,1]

Note: Version 1.1 - Shane added the Regular Expression removal of all non-hex characters.

Parameters:
hexString - hexadecimal string representation
Returns:
